Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the suggestion that Joe Biden and Kamala Harris were flouting public health guidelines during the COVID-19 pandemic by using images taken before the guidelines were implemented.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or context to support the assertion that Biden and Harris were intentionally flouting public health guidelines.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the images were taken during the COVID-19 pandemic in August 2020, when in fact they were taken before the guidelines were implemented.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the images were taken before face masks and social distancing guidelines were implemented, suggesting that Biden and Harris were not following the guidelines when they were not yet in place.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing accurate information about the timing of the images and the implementation of public health guidelines.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
